SEARCH
Module com.example.dicegame
Package model.records.dice

Class Dice

java.lang.Object
model.records.dice.Dice
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CursedDice, LuckyDice, RegularDice, RiskDice
public abstract class Dice extends Object implements Serializable
Abstract base class for creating different types of dice with customizable probabilities. The class handles dice rolling, setting and validating custom probabilities, and storing dice attributes.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • roll

      public void roll()
      Rolls the dice based on the defined probabilities.

    • returnImageName

      public abstract String returnImageName()
      Abstract method to return the image name for the dice's current side. Implemented by subclasses to provide specific image names.
      Returns:
      A string representing the image file name for the current dice side

    • setCustomProbabilities

      public void setCustomProbabilities(Map<Integer,Double> customProbabilities)
      Sets custom probabilities for the dice after validating them.
      Parameters:
      customProbabilities - A map of side numbers to their probabilities
      Throws:
      WrongProbavilitiesSetUp - if the probabilities are invalid

    • resetToStandardProbabilities

      public void resetToStandardProbabilities()
      Resets the dice probabilities to the standard (fair 6-sided) values.

    • validateProbabilities

      private void validateProbabilities(Map<Integer,Double> probs)
      Validates that the given probabilities sum up to 1.0.
      Parameters:
      probs - A map of probabilities to validate
      Throws:
      WrongProbavilitiesSetUp - if the probabilities do not sum to 1.0
